div.l: With kepe · kepe stonde stonde iossa war the rere
Go whistill thou · and y shall kepe here
But shortly till it was verrey nyght
They coude not though they did all here myght
Here Caple cacche he ran̄ all way so fast
Till in a diche they caught hym̄ at the last
Wery and wete as beest is in the reyne
Comth sely Iohn and with hym̄ Aleyne
Allas quod Iohn that day that y was born̄
Nowe are we driven̄ to hethyng and to scorn̄
Oure corn̄ is stole men̄ woll vs fonnes call
Bothe oure warden̄ and oure felawes all
And namely the Millere welaway
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goith by the way
Toward the Mille and bayard in his honde
The Millere sittyng by the fire he fonde
For it was nyght and ferther myght they nought
But for the love of god they hym̄ bysought
Of herborowe and ease as for here peny
The Miller͗e seide ayen̄ yif ther be eny
Suche as it is yit shull ye haue youre parte
Myn̄ house is streite · but ye haue lerned arte
Ye conne by Argumentes make a place
A · Mile brode of · xxᵗⁱ · fote of space
Lette se nowe yif this place may suffise
Or make it romere with speche as is youre gise
Nowe Symond seide this Iohn by seynte CutbertdCutbertCutberd
Ay is thou mery · and that is faire aunswerd
I haue hard sey aman̄ shall take of · ijᵒ · thynges
Suche as he fyndes or suche as he brynges
But specially y pray the hoste dere
Gete vs mete and drynke and make vs chere
And we shull pay truly at the fulle
With empty hande men̄ may none haukis calle
Lo here oure silủere redy for to spende
This Millere to the Toun̄ his doughtᵘur sende
For ale and for brede and rosted hem̄ a goos
And his hors he shulde nomore go loos
And in his owne Chambre he made hem̄ a bedde
With shetes and Chalon̄s feire y spredde
